# itemSet(withPasteboardTypes:)

**Instance Method**

Returns an index set identifying pasteboard items having the specified representation types.

## Declaration

```swift
func itemSet(withPasteboardTypes pasteboardTypes: [String]) -> IndexSet?
```

## Parameters

- **pasteboardTypes**: An array of strings, with each string identifying a representation type. Typically you use UTIs as pasteboard types.

## Return Value

An index set with each integer positionally identifying a pasteboard item that has one of the representation types specified in `pasteboardTypes`.

## Discussion

You can pass the index set returned in this method in a call to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPasteboard/data(forPasteboardType:inItemSet:)] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPasteboard/values(forPasteboardType:inItemSet:)] to get the data in the indicated pasteboard items.

## Related Documentation

- **numberOfItems**: The number of items for the pasteboard.

## Determining types of pasteboard items

- **types**: The types of the first item on the pasteboard.
- **types(forItemSet:)**: Returns an array of representation types for each specified pasteboard item.
- **contains(pasteboardTypes:)**: Returns whether the pasteboard holds data of the specified representation type.
- **contains(pasteboardTypes:inItemSet:)**: Returns whether the specified pasteboard items contain data of the given representation types.
